ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: beginner Portuguese and Brazilian culture/social issues
Introductory exposure to Portuguese/Brazilian language, culture, and world experience. Loved the immersion and the teaching from my Brazilian professors.
I learned the basics of Portuguese, as well as the culture of Brazil.
Brazillian Portuguese grammar, language, and reading skills
The course have insight into the Portuguese language for beginners and also the arts and culture of Brazil and occasionally Portugal.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: no weaknesses. the course is the most engaging i've ever enrolled in. Henrique and Marianna are THE BEST!!! consistent feedback, lively group activities and overall loved going to class everyday

Strengths: Super friendly, accommodating, and helpful professors who actually cared about your personal growth and did their best to give students the tools they needed to succeed. 
Weaknesses: daily course meetings, except Wednesday (asynchronous)

This course could be improved with a more structured vocabulary and grammar system. This course was good at providing a safe space for students to try out their speaking, and learn about new cultures.

Although this course dives deep into speaking and listening skills, it lacks lessons that strictly focus on vocabulary and grammar. This makes it difficult to formulate sentences if they aren't strictly about the topic we are learning in class, which can be at times a bit advanced for an L1 class.
An incredible strength of the course and of the instructors was the use of varied arts and cultural material that made the course very engaging.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, the teachers made learning this language very fun and easy!

YES!! take portuguese if you're looking to learn a new language for fun, like I did, or start your L1. You will learn the language in a non-traditional way through immersing in the culture. the most engaging class!
Yes, absolutely. Great language immersion, fun culture to learn about, and an easier language credit than some of the others. Highly recommend!
Yes, if they want to learn a new language!
Would definitely recommend especially if you are tryin to tie back into your familial roots.
Yes, it was very engaging and interesting, especially the media used in the class.
